etymology.description: 皿(皿) (mǐn, "vessel") + 灰(灰) (huī, phonetic) = vessel-like shape -> original meaning as a type of vessel -> evolved to mean 'helmet' as an inversion of a bowl-like form
etymology.interpretation: 盔(盔) (kuī, "helmet") combines the shape of a vessel from 皿(皿) (mǐn, "vessel") with the sound from 灰(灰) (huī) to emphasize its bowl-like form, which is protective when reversed like a helmet.

examples.chinese: 士兵戴着铁盔(士兵戴著鐵盔)。
examples.english: The soldier wears an iron helmet.

examples.chinese: 古代战士佩戴华丽的盔(古代戰士佩戴華麗的盔)，流露出英雄本色(流露出英雄本色)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài zhànshì pèidài huálì de kuī, liúlù chū yīngxióng běnsè.
examples.english: Ancient warriors don splendid helmets, revealing their heroic character.

examples.chinese: 骑士戴上沉重的盔(騎士戴上沉重的盔)。
examples.english: The knight puts on a heavy helmet.
